page.title: 04Bird Survey
page.content: Ornithologically the area is important as a rare bird, the stone curlew inhabits the area in spring and summer gathering for migration in autumn. In the winter great numbers of birds can be counted; Golden Plover up to 1500 in the Spring Pond area, Lapwings 1000 at any one time, Hen Harriers, Short_ Eared Owls, Fieldfares, and Redwings. In the hedgerows are revealed Goldcrests, Long_tailed Tits, possibly a Snipe.In 1982 the Dottrell was seen. Types of birds seen: Sparrow Hawk,Rook Kestrel, Buzzard, Pheasant, Partridge, Woodpigeon,Skylark,Starling,Magpie, Jackdaw,Rook,Crow,Wren,Dunnock,Robin, Blackbird,Thrush,Mistle_thrush,Tits, Great and Blue,House Sparrow,Chaffinch Greenfinch, Bullfinch,Yellowhammer, Black_Headed Gull,Corn Bunting,Meadow Pipit,Kingfisher, and Pied Wagtail.
